Name: Helvetica-Bold;Times-Roman; ;;; \*;;; 10 Little Fish \'95 10 Pececitos\ Harry Bear and his friends are back, this time in English and Spanish! Dive in, splash along, and count all the fun fish as they swim in the lake. From one to ten, and from diez to uno, count them all while learning opposites like short, long / corto, largo; descriptions like yellow, blue / amarillo, azul; actions like swim, dive / nadar, saltar; and so much more!\ 10 Little Fish combines numbers with simple adjectives ("fish above, fish below; seven fish, fast and slow") and simple verbs ("swim and dive fish, here are five fish"). This fun story is a perfect way to introducing kiddos to language arts in both English y Espa\'f1ol.\ Published by Blue Apple Books, 10 Little Fish is written by Harriet Ziefert and illustrated by Elliot Kreloff.\
Author: \ Harriet Ziefert\ Illustrations:\ Elliot Kreloff\ Release:\ April 2015\ Length:\ 6:12\ Ages:\ 4-8\

Name: Helvetica-Bold;Times-Roman; ;;; \*;;; A Boy Like You\ There are billions of people on the planet. Yet even with all those people, the world still needs a boy like you. A boy who gets that being \'93strong\'94 can mean making sure everyone gets a turn\'97and that being \'93smart\'94 can mean asking for help. A boy who understands how to play hard yet play fair. A boy who would rather pursue what he loves than pretend to be someone he\'92s not.\ \ In the end, what does being a \'93boy\'94 really mean? And how can you \'93be yourself,\'94 regardless of your gender? The truth is, we\'92re all on a journey to answer these questions\'97and this book just might help you along the way.\ \ A touching love letter to the ideals of boyhood, A Boy Like You explores the assumptions and possibilities of who we grow up to be while celebrating the wonderful things we already are. Written by Frank Murphy and illustrated by Kayla Harren, A Boy Like You is published by Sleeping Bear Press.\
Author: \ Frank Murphy\ Illustrations:\ Kayla Harren\ Release:\ July 2019\ Length:\ 6:58\ Ages:\ 4-7

Name: Helvetica-Bold;Times-Roman; ;;; \*;;; 100 First Words for Little Geniuses\ Holy spectroscopy! 100 First Words for Little Geniuses is the perfect book for aspiring geniuses everywhere. Forget starting with words like banana or ball. Why not start with words like inertia, electron, Bunsen burner, or transcendentalism? From chemistry to biology, physics to philosophy, math to art theory, this book truly has something for everyone. Packed with smart and engaging illustrations, 100 First Words for Little Geniuses will have the whole family feeling absolutely brilliant.\ \ 100 First Words for Little Geniuses is created by Tyler Jorden and Kyle Kershner, and published by Familius, a values-driven publisher on a mission to teach, inspire, and bring families together.\

Name: Helvetica-Bold;Times-Roman; ;;; \*;;; A Pet Like No Other\ There are all the \'93normal\'94 pets\'97cats, dogs, hamsters, and the other animals you\'92d find in a pet store. But then there are pets who do fantastic, superb, extraordinary things. Pets with wild hairdos. Pets who make noises like a trumpet. Pets who can walk super tall, lay eggs, and slither around. Even pets that are huggable or waterproof.\ If you could wish for any animal as a pet, which would you choose? And what would make your pet unique? A friend to the end, a pet all your own. You\'92d just have to make a wish, find a leash, and walk them home.\ Pairing kids with the creatures who fit their unique style, A Pet Like No Other embraces all the ways people (and their pets) can truly be one-of-a-kind. Gorgeously illustrated by French artist Barroux, A Pet Like No Other is written by Harriet Ziefert and published by Blue Apple Books.\
Author: \ Harriet Ziefert\ Illustrations:\ Barroux\ Release:\ March 2010\ Length:\ 6:15\ Ages:\ 3-7\

Name: Helvetica-Bold;Times-Roman; ;;; \*;;; A Horse Named Steve\ One day, while walking through the forest, Steve finds a beautiful gold horn. Instantly, he knows he has found the path to being exceptional. (That means special.) Steve ties the horn to the top of his head and prances off to show his friends. Everyone but Bob is impressed\'97and many are so inspired, they start tying items to the top of their heads as well.\ \ But when Steve finds his horn has gone missing, he\'92s devastated. (That means really bummed.) Frantically, he searches to find it. Because without his beautiful gold horn, Steve can\'92t be an exceptional horse. Can he? Come along with Steve as he sets out to find an answer, and a valuable life lesson along the way.\ \ Narrated by the exceptional Rainn Wilson, A Horse Named Steve is a story about how you can be special whether you\'92re different or whether you\'92re just like everyone else. It also celebrates the child-like impulse to be and do what feels fun in the moment. With light vocabulary-building elements, A Horse Named Steve is written and illustrated by Kelly Collier, and published by Kids Can Press.\
Author: \ Kelly Collier\ Illustrations:\ Kelly Collier\ Release:\ April 2017\ Length:\ 7:46\ Ages:\ 4-8\

Name: Helvetica-Bold;Times-Roman;Helvetica; ;;; \*;;; Alice's Magic Garden\ Every great story has a beginning. In this wondrous prequel to Alice\'92s Adventures in Wonderland, Alice first learns how truly magical her world can be. Alice lived at the dreariest boarding school, void of color or cheer. But after discovering a secret garden, and filling it with her love and care, her circumstances begin to change in magical ways!\ \ Alice\'92s Magic Garden tells the story of Alice before the rabbit hole, before wonderland. This delightful story is brimming with charm, whimsy, and a heartfelt message about friendship and kindness. Alice\'92s Magic Garden is written by Henry Herz, illustrated by Natalie Hoopes, and published by Familius. \

Name: Helvetica-Bold;Times-Roman;Helvetica; ;;; \*;;; Alphatrain\ "All aboard the Alphatrain! Learning the alphabet has never been so fun. With a different animal and action representing each letter of the alphabet, little ones will learn their ABCs via fun word associations. Children will absolutely love learning the alphabet in this vibrant, silly title.\ \ Alphatrain is created by Stephanie Miles and Christin Farley, with illustrations by Kaliaha Volha and David Miles, and published by Familius as an adorable two-in-one board book that unfolds into a train!" \

Name: Helvetica-Bold;Times-Roman;Helvetica; ;;; \*;;; Alma and How She Got Her Name\ If you ask her, Alma Sofia Esperanza Jos\'e9 Pura Candela has way too many names: six! How did such a small person wind up with such a large name? Alma turns to Daddy for an answer and learns of Sofia, the grandmother who loved books and flowers; Esperanza, the great-grandmother who longed to travel; Jos\'e9, the grandfather who was an artist; and other namesakes too. As she hears the story of her name, Alma starts to think it might be a perfect fit after all\'97and realizes that she will one day have her own story to tell.\ \ Through Alma\'92s vibrant story, Juana Martinez-Neal opens a treasure box of discovery for children who may be curious about their own origin stories or names. \
Author: \ Juana Martinez-Neal\ Illustrations:\ Juana Martinez-Neal\ Release:\ August 2019\ Length:\ 8:18\ Ages:\ 3-8\

Name: Helvetica-Bold;Times-Roman;Helvetica; ;;; \*;;; Allegro\ Meet Allegro, a young boy who can\'92t stand practicing the piano. It\'92s hard and frustrating and he is ready to give up\'97until the music itself suddenly whisks him away on a magical adventure!Classical music comes to life like never before in this magical journey through 11 timeless compositions. Follow along as Allegro is carried through a range of emotive landscapes, each accompanied by a famous classical theme. Little ones will appreciate music in a whole new way as they discover that becoming a great musician (or anything for that matter) is only possible with patience and practice.\ \ This wondrous story comes from family focused publisher, Familius. Allegro is masterfully written by David Miles and beautifully illustrated by Anita Barghigiani. \
